title: Beyond Force: A Realist Pathway Through the Green Transition - Information Technology and Innovation Foundation
summary: The article argues that forcing the adoption of green technologies through regulations, subsidies, and taxes will not be effective in addressing climate change globally. Instead, it proposes focusing on achieving price/performance parity (P3) for green technologies, which will enable market forces to drive their adoption. This approach emphasizes developing cost-competitive green solutions and fostering innovation to achieve P3, particularly in low-income countries where emissions are rapidly growing.

greenwashing: The article doesn't describe a specific product or process that is an example of greenwashing, but it does mention that some companies may engage in deceptive marketing tactics to portray their products or policies as environmentally responsible.

title: NextEra Energy Resources and Sysco collaborate to develop plan to reduce the foodservice leader's carbon emissions ... - PR Newswire
summary: NextEra Energy Resources, a leader in renewable energy, has partnered with Sysco Corporation, a global foodservice distributor, to develop solutions that reduce Sysco's carbon footprint. Sysco aims to source 100% renewable energy for its global operations, and NextEra Energy Resources will provide a tailored suite of solutions including renewable energy projects, on-site generation, retail renewables, and energy management services.

title: Kohler Co. Outlines Strategy, Ambitions, and Progress in 2022 ESG Report - Contractor Magazine
summary: Kohler Co. released its 2022 ESG report showcasing significant progress in environmental sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), and social impact initiatives. The report highlights achievements in reducing GHG emissions, water usage, and waste, as well as expanding clean energy offerings and promoting associate engagement in community outreach. Kohler continues to innovate with products like the WaterSense-labeled toilets and faucets and the KOHLER generator utilizing HVO fuel for renewable energy solutions.

title: Kohler Launches Limited-Edition Heritage Colors Collection in Spring Green and Peachblow - Yahoo Finance
summary: Kohler, a company known for its kitchen and bath products, has launched a Heritage Colors Collection featuring vintage Spring Green and Peachblow colors on select products. This collection celebrates the company's design legacy and the use of color as an innovative movement, drawing inspiration from the vibrant, colorful products introduced in 1927.  Designers Justina Blakeney and Jonathan Adler showcase how these colors can be incorporated into home design, creating warm and personalized bathroom spaces.

title: Qcells maintains No. 1 position in both U.S. residential & commercial solar market segments - PR Newswire
summary: Qcells, a leading provider of solar energy solutions, has maintained its top position in the US residential and commercial solar markets, achieving 35% market share in both sectors for Q1 2023.  The company is investing over $2.5 billion to create a comprehensive solar supply chain in the US, ensuring the availability of clean energy while also pursuing the EPEAT ecolabel for some of its solar panels to further demonstrate its commitment to sustainability.  Qcells' significant investments and focus on sustainability reinforce its position as a leader in the renewable energy industry.

title: Risen Energy Signs 1GW HJT Module Supply Agreement with Athein - Canada NewsWire
summary: Risen Energy, a leading solar company, has signed a supply agreement with Athein Holding Pte Ltd, an independent power producer platform company, to provide up to 1 GWp of Heterojunction with Intrinsic Thin layer (HJT) photovoltaic modules. title: Shifting the EV sector to the next gear - The Borneo Post
summary: Malaysia is aggressively pursuing a transition to electric vehicles (EVs), with government incentives, infrastructure investments, and the arrival of major players like Tesla and Geely.  The country aims to become a regional hub for EV production and support services, leveraging its existing manufacturing capabilities and promoting a cleaner transportation future.  Analysts expect significant growth in Southeast Asia's EV market, with both government support and increasing consumer demand driving the shift toward sustainable mobility.

title: Toray Set to Increase Carbon Fiber Capacity to Meet Growing Demand in Pressure Vessel Applications - PR Newswire
summary: Toray Composite Materials America, Inc. (Toray CMA) is expanding its carbon fiber production facility in Spartanburg, SC to meet the growing demand for clean energy solutions. The expansion will increase the supply of industrial-strength carbon fiber for hydrogen tanks and other pressure vessel applications, enabling Toray to better serve customers in aerospace, defense, industrial, sports and recreation, and automotive markets.
